newsitem.title: GERMANY: Prosecutors to focus on banks, others in SAP probe.
newsitem.headline: Prosecutors to focus on banks, others in SAP probe.

text.p: German prosecutors said Friday that their inquiry into allegations of insider trading at software group SAP AG would now focus on banks and individuals with ties to the firm.

The prosecutors' spokesman said it was still not clear how many people outside SAP would be involved in the new investigation. He also also said its the prosecutors' probe within SAP itself could well be closed within a few weeks.
He repeated, however, that there was no suspicion of primary insider trading -- that is, by people with direct access to stock-sensitive information.

Since 1994 insider trading has been punishable in Germany with up to five years imprisonment, with primary insiders likely to receive stiffer penalties than those with more limited access to information.
